text:
Hi all!
For marketplace themes HubSpot assigns a version number for each theme update. The version number can be found in the `theme.json` file and its `version` property.
Is there any way to access this version number via HubL?
I was not able to find anything in the docs or via developer info.

Hello everyone!
Two questions.
1. Does anyone know why in developer mode of blog posts there is no option to copy as hubl? And if there's a way around that? 
2. I feel like this should be obvious but I'm struggling. I have a hubl blog template from a theme, which calls a standard blog-post module. I would like to set the template to have some default content for content.post_body. I thought setting post_body='default copy' in the module block would do the trick, but it doesn't.

I also tried using
content={post_body:'test content'}
